Vocabularies.Definition: n. wrong or excessive use; cruel treatment 滥用；虐待 e.g.   The World Health Organization (WHO) has published a report on drug abuse and addiction.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The World Health Organization (WHO) has published a report on drug abuse and addiction.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  口音
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He speaks with a German accent.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a particular way of considering an issue, etc. 角度，立场
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Seen from this angle the woman in the picture is smiling.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 讨厌的，恼人的 annoy vt. make angry, irritate; bother 使恼怒，使烦恼
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The annoying thing about the plan is that it's confusing.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 一套公寓房间；公寓 e.g.   How many bedrooms do you have in your new apartment?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   How many bedrooms do you have in your new apartment?

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 约会
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   You can't see the president of the university unless you make an appointment.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. 适当地，得体地 appropriate a.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Those children aren't appropriately dressed for this cold weather.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. prepare or plan 安排
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Her marriage was arranged by her parents.

Vocabularies.Definition: sometimes 有时
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She has been away form her home for about a year. At times she wishes she had never left.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a strong feeling of dislike 厌恶，反感
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Her aversion to alcohol caused her to avoid her friends' wedding party.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. having a bad temper 脾气坏的，易怒的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   When his headaches developed, Nick became bad-tempered and even violent.

Vocabularies.Definition: yet at the same time 但另一方面，然而
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He got turned down for a promotion, but then he never expected to get it.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. （使）发咔哒声；用鼠标点击 n. 咔哒声
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   When shopping online, you just click the mouse and order what you want to buy.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. with a short clear pronunciation 发音快而清脆的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The chief executive officer's clipped tones cracked over the telephone line.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  商业广告 a.  商业的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I hate commercials on television.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. 通信，交往
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Some young people depend heavily on email to communicate with each other.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  连接
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   This town has very good road and railway connections with the coast.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. 相反地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   You can add the fluid to the powder or, conversely, the powder to the fluid.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. 爬，爬行
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The wounded man crawled to the phone.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. （犯）罪
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We need a positive program of crime prevention.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a person who judges or criticizes 评论家；对…持批评态度的人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Art critics praised the young artist's work.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 提示， 暗示
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   When he started to talk about the finances, that was our cue to get up and quietly leave.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  （datum 的复数形式）数据，资料
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   This data is stored on the network and can be accessed by anybody.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. persistently 顽强地， 坚持不懈地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She would fight doggedly for her rights as the children's mother.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. revise or correct 编辑
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Jack is busy editing Shakespeare's plays for use in schools.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 电子邮件 vt. 给…发电子邮件；用电子邮件发
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Young people like to keep in touch with their friends via email.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  感情上的；动感情的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She is grateful to him for his emotional support while she was in trouble.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  having or seeming to have no end 无休止的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The journey seemed endless.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. 从外面，在外部 external a. 外面的，外部的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Vitamins can be applied externally to the skin.

Vocabularies.Definition: (fled) v. run away (from) 逃走；逃离
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The customers fled from the bank when the alarm sounded.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  not stable, likely to change 不稳定的，可变的 n. 液体
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The situation is still fluid.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  体育馆， 健身房
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The basketball game was held in the gymnasium.

Vocabularies.Definition: visible; likely to come soon 可看到的；临近
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It was early in the morning and there wasn't anyone in sight on campus.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  not able to feel, unsympathetic to other people's feelings 感觉迟钝的， 麻木不仁的 sensitive a.  敏感的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   My mother was a thinking woman, not an insensitive one.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  交往；相互作用 cyber-interaction n.  通过网络交往
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   There is need for greater interaction among the different departments.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  互联网，因特网
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Whether we like it or not, the Internet is an ever-growing part of our lives.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. 理解；解释；（作）口译
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I would interpret his silence as a refusal.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.，vt. 接见； 面试
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The TV interview has been cancelled.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. too bad to be endured 不能忍受的，无法容忍的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The pain was so intolerable that I wished I was dead.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. 使感到不快，刺激（神经等）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   You shouldn't have too many colors in a small space as the effect can jar.

Vocabularies.Definition: learn about or be aware of (the news, etc.); move at the same rate as 及时了解或跟上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Carrie likes to keep up with the latest fashions.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  笑，笑声
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   "Laughter is the best medicine" means that trying to be happy is a good way to fight worries.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. understand wrongly 错误地理解， 错误地解释
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The President's words had been misinterpreted.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 调制解调器
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He sent his work to the publishers by modem.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a terrifying dream 噩梦
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Tom didn't eat fish because it gives him nightmares.

Vocabularies.Definition: connected to or controlled by a computer (network) 联机地，在线
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Our system is on line to the main computer.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 歌剧 （艺术） soap opera 肥皂剧 （以家庭问题为题材的广播或电视连续剧）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He is writing a book on Italian opera.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 口令，密码
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   No one could use the computer unless they had a password.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. imagine that others have (the same feelings, usu. unpleasant ones) as you 以为别人也有（与自己同样的情绪）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He projects his own thoughts and ideas onto her.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  关系 e.g.   What is the relationship between language and thought?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   What is the relationship between language and thought?

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. depend confidently, put trust in 依靠，依赖
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Nowadays we rely increasingly on computers to control the flow of traffic.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 言辞，话语 v. 说，评说
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The principal of the school made some remarks about educational reform at the meeting.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. bring back to former condition 恢复
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The army has recently been brought in to restore order.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 例行事务，日常工作，惯例
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The job is really just a dull series of fairly routine tasks. I don't think you'll take it.

Vocabularies.Definition: 使分离，使分开
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   What sets it apart from hundreds of similar small French towns is the huge factory.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. mix socially with others 社交，交际
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It distressed her that she no longer socialized with old friends.

Vocabularies.Definition: (spat or spit) vt. 吐出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The baby spat its food out on the table.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. (cause to) become longer, wider, etc. without breaking 拉长, 伸展
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   My working day stretches from seven in the morning to eight at night.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. give (sth.) to sb. so that it may be formally considered 提交，呈递
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I am going to submit an application for that job in Microsoft.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  draw liquid or air into the mouth 吸，吮 suck in 吸引，使卷入；吸收
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I don't want to get sucked into the debate about school reform.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 自杀
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   There were three suicides in one week.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 征兆；症状
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   High interest rates are a symptom of a weak economy.

Vocabularies.Definition: 收进，吸收
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The earth takes in heat and light from the sun.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. one who works from home, communicating with the workplace using a computer terminal 远程工作者
n. 语气， 口气，腔调
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   From he tone of her voice I could tell she was very angry.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. T 恤衫
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   T-shirts usually have short sleeves.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 曲子，曲调
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She whistled a happy tune all the way home.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 内衣
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He went for a late-night swim in his underwear.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 失业
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He was thrown into unemployment when the factory closed.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.虚拟的; 实质上的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I can visit a virtual store and put what I want in my basket at the click of a mouse button.

Vocabularies.Definition: annoy
appropriate
cyber-interaction
soap opera
suck in
